00001 #include <epi.h>
00002 
00003 void
00004 timer_helper(epi_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00005 {
00006         epi_agent        *a;
00007 
00008         // timer fired, so reset time to next lowest agent
00009         // Note that queue may be empty because the only agent in this location died.
00010         if(NULL != (a = pq_top(state->pq)))
00011         {
00012                 if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00013                 {
00014                         a->e_type = EPI_STAGE_TRANSITION;
00015                         state->tmr_remove = epi_timer_start(a, state->tmr_remove,
00016                                 a->ts_stage_tran, lp);
00017                 } else
00018                 {
00019                         a->e_type = EPI_REMOVE;
00020                         state->tmr_remove = epi_timer_start(a, state->tmr_remove,
00021                                 a->ts_remove, lp);
00022                 }
00023         } else
00024                 state->tmr_remove = NULL;
00025 }
00026 
00027 /*
00028  * State changes occur when an agent is added or removed from a group,
00029  * or when an agent changes stage.  In either case, a check is made
00030  * to see if anyone becomes infected (change from stage 0 to stage 1).
00031  * The timer for the next event can be for a remove or for stage
00032  * transition.  Adds are performed by a message from another group.
00033  * Each agent has two possible times for the next event, the remove
00034  * time (ts_remove) and the stage change time (ts_stage_tran).
00035  */
00036 
00037 /*
00038  * Stage transition causes the agent to be removed from the
00039  * queue (it is at the head), increment the stage, collect
00040  * statistics, and place back in the queue with the minimum
00041  * of the next stage transition time and the remove time.
00042  */
00043 void
00044 epi_agent_stage_tran(epi_state * state, tw_bf * bf, epi_agent * a, tw_lp * lp)
00045 {
00046         epi_ic_stage    *s;
00047 
00048         // this agent is at head of pq
00049         a = pq_dequeue(state->pq);
00050 
00051         // simple error checking
00052         if(NULL == a)
00053                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Empty PQ!");
00054 
00055         // if this agent is contagious in the old stage, then reduce the location number of
00056         // contagious agents by one.
00057         s = &g_epi_stages[a->stage];
00058         if (abs(s->ln_multiplier) > EPSILON)
00059                 state->ncontagious--;
00060 
00061         if(state->ncontagious < 0)
00062                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Less than zero ncontagious!");
00063 
00064         g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]--;
00065         a->stage++;
00066         g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]++;
00067 
00068         if (a->stage >= g_epi_nstages)
00069                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Invalid stage: %d", a->stage);
00070 
00071         s = &g_epi_stages[a->stage];
00072         a->ts_last_tran = tw_now(lp);
00073         if (abs(s->max_duration - s->min_duration) < EPSILON)
00074                 a->ts_stage_tran += s->min_duration;
00075         else
00076                 a->ts_stage_tran += s->min_duration + 
00077                                 tw_rand_unif(lp->id) * (s->max_duration - s->min_duration);
00078 
00079         // Perform mortality check
00080         if (tw_rand_unif(lp->id) < s->mortality_rate )
00081         {
00082                 pq_dequeue(state->pq);
00083                 g_epi_ct[a->ct][a->stage]--;
00084                 a->stage = g_epi_nstages;
00085                 a->days_remaining = 0;
00086                 g_epi_ct[a->ct][g_epi_nstages]++;
00087 
00088                 // collect statistics
00089                 state->stats->s_ndead++;
00090         } else
00091         {
00092                 // if new stage has infectivity, 
00093                 // then increment location number of contagious agents.
00094                 if (abs(s->ln_multiplier) > EPSILON)
00095                 {
00096                         state->ncontagious++;
00097                 
00098                         // then must set number of days to stay home
00099                         if(!(a->behavior_flags & EPI_AGENT_WORK_WHILE_SICK))
00100                                 a->days_remaining = ((int) a->ts_stage_tran / tw_now(lp)) + 1;
00101                 }
00102 
00103                 if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00104                         a->ts_next = a->ts_stage_tran;
00105                 else
00106                         a->ts_next = a->ts_remove;
00107 
00108                 // re-enqueue with new ts_next
00109                 pq_enqueue(state->pq, a);
00110         }
00111 
00112         timer_helper(state, lp);
00113 }
00114 
00115         /*
00116          * Adding an agent means placing them into our PQ.  If agent
00117          * remove ts is < PQ->min, then must update LP remove timer.
00118          *
00119          * Check time for stage change.  Place in queue by minimum
00120          * stage change time or remove time.  Set timer for stage
00121          * change time (and event) or remove time (and event).
00122          */
00123 void
00124 epi_agent_add(epi_state * state, tw_bf * bf, epi_agent * a, tw_lp * lp)
00125 {
00126         // Test to make sure this location is this lp
00127         if (lp->id != a->loc[a->curr])
00128                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "epi_agent_add adding agent %d to lp %d but loc[%d] is %d",
00129                          a->id, lp->id, a->curr, a->loc[a->curr]);
00130 
00131         // if agent is contagious, increment number of contagious agents here
00132         if (abs(g_epi_stages[a->stage].ln_multiplier) > EPSILON)
00133                 state->ncontagious++;
00134 
00135         a->ts_remove = tw_now(lp) + a->dur[a->curr];
00136 
00137         /* need to check stage time */
00138         if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00139                 a->ts_next = a->ts_stage_tran;
00140         else
00141                 a->ts_next = a->ts_remove;
00142 
00143         pq_enqueue(state->pq, a);
00144 
00145         if(pq_get_size(state->pq) > state->max_queue_size)
00146                 state->max_queue_size = pq_get_size(state->pq);
00147 
00148 // If not at home, if agent is a worried well, if there are already enough symtomatic
00149 // people here then starting tomorrow, this agent will stay home for the number
00150 // of days remaining.  days_remaining is checked in agent_remove().
00151         
00152         if(!a->days_remaining && a->nloc > 1 && a->loc[a->curr] != a->loc[0] && 
00153                 (a->behavior_flags & EPI_AGENT_WORRIED_WELL))
00154         {
00155                 if ((float) state->ncontagious / (float) state->max_queue_size > 
00156                                 g_epi_worried_well_threshold)
00157                 {
00158                         a->days_remaining = g_epi_worried_well_duration;
00159                 }
00160         }
00161 
00162         // Update the REMOVE timer.
00163         // in case of tie in PQ, the timer agent should match the PQ min agent
00164 /*
00165         if(!state->tmr_remove || 
00166            a->ts_next < state->tmr_remove->recv_ts ||
00167            a == pq_top(state->pq))
00168 */
00169         timer_helper(state, lp);
00170 }
00171 
00172         /*
00173          * epi_agent_add_back: helper routine that adds an agent back to the
00174          *                     queue from which it was just removed
00175          *        Must call num_add if appropriate, since we are skipping
00176          *        the EPI_ADD event
00177          */
00178 void
00179 epi_agent_add_back(epi_state * state, tw_lp * lp, epi_agent * a)
00180 {
00181         // Need to move curr but not change location.
00182         if(++a->curr >= a->nloc)
00183                 a->curr = 0;
00184 
00185         a->ts_remove = tw_now(lp) + a->dur[a->curr];
00186 
00187         if (a->ts_stage_tran <= a->ts_remove)
00188                 a->ts_next = a->ts_stage_tran;
00189         else
00190                 a->ts_next = a->ts_remove;
00191 
00192         pq_enqueue(state->pq, a);
00193         epi_num_add(state, (tw_bf *) NULL, a, lp);
00194 
00195         timer_helper(state, lp);
00196 }
00197 
00198         /*
00199          * When the LPs REMOVE timer fires, we should dequeue the next agent
00200          * and send it on to it's next location.  We must set the next remove
00201          * timer appropriately for the agents remaining in our PQ.
00202          *
00203          * If the remove is from location 0, then this is the first move of the
00204          * day, i.e., from home.  We activate agent logic to see if agent
00205          * will stay home today, due to quarantine, being ill, or having
00206          * ill spouse or children to care for.
00207          *
00208          * NOTE: We want the agent in the event to be consistent with the
00209          * agent in the timer, even if they have the same remove timestamp.
00210          * The reason for this is that in the reverse computation, I need to put
00211          * the agent back into the PQ, and where else can I get it from but the
00212          * timer event?
00213          *
00214          */
00215 int
00216 epi_agent_remove(epi_state * state, tw_bf * bf, epi_agent * a, tw_lp * lp)
00217 {
00218         tw_event        *e;
00219 
00220         a = pq_dequeue(state->pq);
00221 
00222         // simple error checking
00223         if(NULL == a)
00224                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Empty PQ!");
00225 
00226         // if days_remaining > 0, then go through motions by moving curr, but
00227         // do not move agent.  Thus, a->loc[a->curr] may not be home.  Need
00228         // to do this in order to send network traffic.
00229         // only change days_remaining at midnight, so when days_remaining goes
00230         // to zero, curr will go to zero and agent will be at home.
00231         // Make sure agent is at home.  If agent becomes worried well at
00232         // work, must continue to move until he is at home.
00233         if(a->days_remaining && lp->id == a->loc[0])
00234         {
00235                 if ((int) tw_now(lp) % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS == 0)
00236                 {
00237                         if(--a->days_remaining)
00238                         {
00239                                 epi_agent_add_back(state, lp, a);
00240 
00241                                 return 0;
00242                         }
00243                 } else
00244                 {
00245                         epi_agent_add_back(state, lp, a);
00246 
00247                         return 0;
00248                 }
00249         }
00250 
00251         // if agent is contagious, decrement number of contagious agents in this location
00252         if (abs(g_epi_stages[a->stage].ln_multiplier) > EPSILON)
00253                 state->ncontagious--;
00254 
00255         if (state->ncontagious < 0)
00256                 tw_error(TW_LOC,"Less than zero contagious agents in %d", lp->id);
00257 
00258         // increment location
00259         if(++a->curr >= a->nloc)
00260                 a->curr = 0;
00261 
00262         e = rn_event_direct(tw_getlp(a->loc[a->curr]), 0.0, lp);
00263         e->memory = (tw_memory *) a;
00264         a->e_type = EPI_ADD;
00265 
00266         rn_event_send(e);
00267 
00268         timer_helper(state, lp);
00269 
00270         // Collect statistics
00271         state->stats->s_move_ev++;
00272 
00273         return 1;
00274 }
